title: Augusta County: William B. Gallaher to E.C. Gallaher, August 8, 1861
summary: William B. Gallaher complains to his mother about the Yankee depletion of food resources which prompted raids on Yankee farms in Fairfax. He received his commission as second lieutenant and anticipates resigning when he gets "tired of soldiering" in a few weeks.
keywords: This letter was transcribed from another transcribed copy.
